def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Shoot the first zombie
    ammo -= 1
    shot += 1
    
    # Check if all zombies have been shot
    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."
    
    # Check if there are no more bullets
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    
    # Move the remaining zombies forward
    distance -= 0.5 * (zombies - shot)
    
    # Check if any zombies have reached you
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # Recursively call the function with updated parameters
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

    # Shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    ammo -= 1

    # Check if all zombies are shot
    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if out of ammo
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Move remaining zombies closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if zombies reach 0 distance
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Recursively call the function
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    zombies -= 1

    # Check if all zombies are shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

    # Move zombies closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if distance reached 0
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Check if out of ammo
    if ammo == 1:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Reduce ammo count
    ammo -= 1

    # Recursive call
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # While there are still zombies and ammo left
    while zombies > 0 and ammo > 0:
        # Shoot one zombie
        zombies -= 1
        # Decrease the distance by 0.5 meters
        distance -= 0.5
        # Increase the shot counter by 1
        shot += 1
    # If all zombies are shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."
    # If there are still zombies and no ammo left
    elif zombies > 0 and ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    # If there are no zombies left and ammo is still available
    elif zombies == 0 and ammo > 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    # If there are still zombies and no ammo left, but distance is 0
    elif zombies > 0 and ammo == 0 and distance == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # calculate the number of seconds it takes for the zombies to reach 0 meters
    seconds = distance / 0.5
    
    # iterate through each second
    for i in range(int(seconds)):
        # shoot one zombie
        shot += 1
        
        # check if all zombies have been shot
        if shot == zombies:
            return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."
        
        # decrement ammo
        ammo -= 1
        
        # check if ammo has run out
        if ammo == 0:
            return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
        
        # move remaining zombies forward 0.5 meters
        distance -= 0.5
        
        # check if any zombie has reached 0 meters
        if distance <= 0:
            return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # check if any zombie has reached 0 meters after the last second
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # if there are still zombies remaining after all seconds, but ammo has run out
    return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Check if there are no zombies left
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."
    
    # Check if there are no bullets left
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    
    # Shoot one zombie
    zombies -= 1
    shot += 1
    
    # Move all remaining zombies forward
    distance -= 0.5 * zombies
    
    # Check if any zombies reached the player
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # Recursively call the function with updated values
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo - 1, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # calculate the number of seconds it takes for the zombies to reach 0 meters
    seconds = distance / 0.5
    
    # iterate through each second
    for i in range(int(seconds)):
        # shoot one zombie
        shot += 1
        
        # check if all zombies have been shot
        if shot == zombies:
            return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."
        
        # decrement ammo
        ammo -= 1
        
        # check if ammo has run out
        if ammo == 0:
            return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
        
        # move remaining zombies forward 0.5 meters
        distance -= 0.5
        
        # check if any zombie has reached 0 meters
        if distance <= 0:
            return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # check if any zombie has reached 0 meters after the last second
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # if there are still zombies remaining after all seconds, but ammo has run out
    return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

  # while there are still zombies and ammo
  while zombies > 0 and ammo > 0:

    # shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    zombies -= 1
    ammo -= 1

    # move remaining zombies closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # check if any zombies have reached the player
    if distance <= 0:
      return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

  # check if all zombies have been killed
  if zombies == 0:
    return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

  # check if ammo ran out before killing all zombies
  if ammo == 0:
    return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # calculate the number of seconds it takes for the zombies to reach 0 meters
    seconds = distance / 0.5
    
    # iterate through each second
    for i in range(int(seconds)):
        # shoot one zombie
        shot += 1
        
        # check if all zombies have been shot
        if shot == zombies:
            return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."
        
        # decrement ammo
        ammo -= 1
        
        # check if ammo has run out
        if ammo == 0:
            return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
        
        # move remaining zombies forward 0.5 meters
        distance -= 0.5
        
        # check if any zombie has reached 0 meters
        if distance <= 0:
            return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # check if any zombie has reached 0 meters after the last second
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # if there are still zombies remaining after all seconds, but ammo has run out

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

  # while there are still zombies and ammo
  while zombies > 0 and ammo > 0:

    # shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    zombies -= 1
    ammo -= 1

    # move remaining zombies closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # check if any zombies have reached the player
    if distance <= 0:
      return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

  # check if all zombies have been killed
  if zombies == 0:
    return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

  # check if ammo ran out before killing all zombies
  if ammo == 0:
    return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    while ammo > 0:
        # Shoot a zombie
        ammo -= 1
        shot += 1
        zombies -= 1
        
        # Check if all zombies are shot
        if zombies == 0:
            return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."
        
        # Move zombies closer
        distance -= 0.5
        
        # Check if zombies have reached 0
        if distance <= 0:
            return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # Run out of ammo before shooting all zombies
    return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
